item.title: Nahum 1
item.description:
Nahum Chapter 1

1The Oracle of Nahum The Book of the Vision of Nahum Yahveh’s Anger Against Nineveh

2Yahveh is an exclusive God that avenges with anger. He carries out vengeance on his adversaries; he stores up anger for his enemies.

3He doesn’t get mad quick, but he does exert his power; he doesn’t let the guilty go free. He displays his power in storms and tornadoes; clouds are dust beneath his feet.

item.title: Nahum 2
item.description:
Nahum Chapter 2

1Attackers are advancing to crush you, Nineveh. Man the ramparts, guard the road, muster your forces, get ready.

2Yahveh is going to restore majesty to Jacob, splendor to Israel; because plunderers have stripped it and cut the branches off its grapevines.

Nah 2:1-2

3The shields of the valiant flash red; the soldiers wear scarlet uniforms; the chariots glitter like steel as they muster into formation; they rattle their cypress spears.

item.title: Nahum 3
item.description:
Nahum Chapter 3

1Misfortune awaits bloody Nineveh, filled with lies and pillage and plunder without limit.

2Do you hear the crack of whips, rattling wheels, galloping horses, rushing chariots!?

3Do you see cavalry charging, swords flashing, spears gleaming, many slain, piles of corpses, countless bodies, and people stumbling over them!?

4That’s all because of your continual prostitution, that charming mistress of sorceries; you sell nations by your prostitution, countries by your sorceries. 5“I’m your enemy,” Yahveh of hosts says; “I’ll pull your skirts up over your faces, and show the nations your nakedness, the kingdoms your disgrace.
